decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): Site Location Plan Dwg. No. 2317-PL-001, Site Plan - Existing and Proposed Dwg. No. 2317-PL-002, Existing First Floor and Loft Plans Dwg. No. 2317-PL-101 rev B, Existing Roof Plan Dwg. No. 2317-PL-102 rev B, Existing Side and Rear Elevations Dwg. No. 2317-PL-104 rev B, Existing Sections Dwg. No. 2317-PL-105 rev B, Proposed First Floor and Loft Plans Dwg. No. 2317-PL-201 rev B, Proposed Roof Plan Dwg. No. 2317-PL-202 rev B, Proposed Side and Rear Elevations Dwg. No. 2317-PL-204 rev B, Proposed Sections Dwg. No. 2317-PL-205 rev B, Design, Access and Heritage Statement dated December 2023 part 1,  Design, Access and Heritage Statement dated December 2023 part 2, Supporting Document "Parking Provision".
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| Notwithstanding the hereby approve plans and documents listed in condition 2 above, the proposed roof light on the side roofslope shall be of the non-projecting 'Conservation Style' and shall be installed flush with the plane of the roof and shall be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring a high quality of design that preserves or enhances the character and appearance of the Mill Hill Park Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the hereby approved extension.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Rear dormer window to rear roofslope; alterations to lean to rear outrigger extension involving increasing height of parapet wall, insertion of a one rooflight to the flat roof of outrigger extension; repoint chimney; installation of one rooflight to east side elevation; alterations and works to the roof including the re-roofing
